member.name: IEnumCATEGORYINFO.Clone

summary.para: Creates a new enumerator that contains the same enumeration state as the current one.

This method makes it possible to record a point in the enumeration sequence in order to return to that point at a later time. The caller must release this new enumerator separately from the first enumerator.

member.param: A pointer to the cloned enumerator object.
member.returns: This method can return the standard return values E_INVALIDARG, E_OUTOFMEMORY, E_UNEXPECTED, and S_OK.

member.name: IEnumCATEGORYINFO.Next
member.summary: Retrieves the specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: The number of items to be retrieved. If there are fewer than the requested number of items left in the sequence, this method retrieves the remaining elements.

param.name: rgelt
param.para: The enumerator is responsible for allocating any memory, and the caller is responsible for freeing it. If celt is greater than 1, the caller must also pass a non-NULL pointer passed to pceltFetched to know how many pointers to release.

member.param: The number of items that were retrieved. This parameter is always less than or equal to the number of items requested.
member.returns: If the method retrieves the number of items requested, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is S_FALSE.

member.name: IEnumCATEGORYINFO.Reset
member.summary: Resets the enumeration sequence to the beginning.

member.name: IEnumCATEGORYINFO.Skip
member.summary: Skips over the specified number of items in the enumeration sequence.
member.param: The number of items to be skipped.
member.returns: If the method skips the number of items requested, the return value is S_OK. Otherwise, it is S_FALSE.

member.name: IEnumCATEGORYINFO
member.summary: Enumerates component categories registered in the system.
